sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten letter from Harden to Schenker, dated December 23, 1896
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Harden rejects the notion of publishing an article by Schenker anonymously; he agrees with Schenker that a frontal attack on modernism is necessary; he says he does not know Hofmannsthal’s poetry, but hears he has great talent.
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Harden, Maximilian; Schenker, Heinrich; Hauptmann, Gerhard; Versunkene Glocke; Ibsen; Hofmannsthal; poetry

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten letter from Harden to Schenker, dated December 23, 1896

tei:transcription.tei:p: es thut mir aufrichtig leid, aber einen solchen Artikel kann ich nicht anonÿm bringen. Schenker's request is not known to survive. It is noteworthy that Schenker published his Harmonielehre (1906) at first anonymously as "by an artist" [von einem Künstler]. Nehmen Sie herzlichen Dank, auch für Ihre liebenswürdigen Worte. Ich glaube auch, daß es Zeit ist, den „Modernen“ urwüchsig grob entgegenzutreten. Kennen Sie die versunkene Glocke? A play by Germany’s leading exponent of dramatic Naturalism, Gerhard Hauptmann (1862–1946), which premiered in Berlin on December 2, 1896. This play is quite unlike Hauptmann’s earlier work, which is reminiscent of Ibsen in its depiction of the physical and psychological stresses of modern industrial materialism; it is instead a dramatic fairy-tale, suffused with dark, romantic magicalism. Schenker's diary contains notes on three Hauptmann plays: Führmann Henschel (1898; OJ 1/2, p. 6), Und Pippa tanzt (May 27, 1906; OJ 1/5, p. 13), and Florian Geyer (June 1, 1907; OJ 1/6, p. 43). Das ist der höchste Heurige. Hofmannsthals Hugo von Hofmannsthal (1874-1929), Viennese poet, librettist, and dramatist. Gedichte kenne ich nicht, er schrieb mir neulich sehr leutselig, freilich aus der Höhe, ich hörte stets, er sei ein außerordentliches Talent.
Mit guten Festgrüßen, in herzlicher Hochachtung Ihr ergebener [signed:] Harden

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten letter from Harden to Schenker, dated December 23, 1896

tei:translation.tei:p: I am truly sorry, but I cannot publish this sort of article anonymously. Please accept my sincere gratitude, and for your kind words as well. I too believe that it is time to confront the “moderns” head-on. Do you know The Submerged Bell? It’s the hit of the season. I don’t know Hofmannsthal’s poems; he wrote to me very affably just the other day, completely out of the blue; I’ve always heard that he is an exceptional talent.
With good wishes for the holiday, in sincere esteem, Yours truly, [signed:] Harden
